title: Pushes, Pulls, and Motion

vocab.definition: A push or pull that can make objects move or change direction
When an object changes position or moves from one place to another
The way something moves: up, down, left, right, forward, or backward
How fast or slow something moves
A simple shape that points to show direction

teachingNotes: Use playground equipment and classroom demonstrations. Let students experiment with different forces and observe motion changes. Connect to everyday experiences.

sample.question: What happens when you push a ball harder?
What happens when you pull a wagon?
Name one way to change an object's speed.
Name one way to change an object's direction.
What force slows things down on the ground?

truefalse.question: Both pushes and pulls are types of forces.
Force can change how fast something moves.
You don't need force to start motion.
Pushing and pulling are the same thing.
A harder push makes a toy car go faster.

multiplechoice.question: To make a swing move, you need to apply what?
What happens if you push a cart gently?
Which way will a ball go if you push it from the left?
What tool helps measure how far something moved?

fillintheblank.question: When you _____ a door, it opens away from you.
When you _____ a door, it opens toward you.
A harder push makes an object go _____.
A softer push makes an object go _____.
